title: recipes_Summer_Squash_Casserole_with_Nuts
text:
Title: Summer Squash Casserole with Nuts.
.
Description: This is a recipe that my Southern mother-in-law gave to me, her Yankee daughter-in-law! Zucchini or yellow summer squash may be used together, or interchangeably to create this delicious casserole! Use bread crumbs, crushed crackers or cheese for the topping..
.
Ingredients:.
- 1 pound summer squash, sliced.
- 0.25 cup butter.
- 0.25 cup chopped green bell pepper.
- 1 tablespoon white sugar.
- 0.5 cup chopped onion.
- 1 egg.
- 0.5 cup mayonnaise.
- salt and pepper to taste.
- 0.5 cup shredded Cheddar cheese.
- 0.5 cup pecans, chopped.
- 0.5 cup bread crumbs.
.
Instructions:.
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)..
- Bring a large pot of water to boil. Add squash, and cook until tender. Drain well..
- Place squash in a large mixing bowl. Add butter, reserving 1/2 tablespoon, to the squash and mash well. Mix bell pepper, sugar, onion, egg, mayonnaise, salt and pepper, cheese and nuts to the mixture. Transfer the mixture to a 1-quart casserole dish. Top with bread crumbs. Dot with the reserved butter..
- Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 to 40 minutes..
.
Nutrients:.
calories: 250 kcal.
carbohydrateContent: 10 g.
cholesterolContent: 46 mg.
fiberContent: 2 g.
proteinContent: 5 g.
saturatedFatContent: 7 g.
sodiumContent: 198 mg.
sugarContent: 4 g.
fatContent: 22 g.
unsaturatedFatContent: 0 g.
.
Serves: 9 servings.
